backend/main.mo: Defines audit log types, access control state, user and controller records, and exposes initialization and role/query methods for the backend canister.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature evidence entries describing role‑copy updates, associated files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of many frontend components, hooks, panels, and styles used across the application.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and theme variable definitions providing OKLCH color system for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML entry point that loads the React application from main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app handling authentication, role checks, view switching, profile setup, and routing to dashboards or access‑denied screen.
frontend/src/components/AccessDeniedScre: UI screen shown when access is denied, offering login, unsupported‑role warnings, principal copy, and ICP panels for authenticated users.
frontend/src/components/AuditLogDetailDi: Displays detailed audit log information with formatted timestamps, severity indicators, and descriptions of action types.
Shows user authentication status, principal ID, and backend connectivity warnings with options to copy the principal and retry health checks.
frontend/src/components/BroadcastConfigP: Allows configuring external broadcasting settings, including enabling alerts and setting an endpoint URL with validation and mutation support.
Provides a file-based code editor with category switching, unsaved change prompts, apply/reset actions, and persistence via storage utilities.
frontend/src/components/DashboardViewSwi: Renders buttons to switch between security and ICP operations dashboards when permitted.
Presents Caffeine platform deployment steps and links, including guidance and informational alerts.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Simple footer displaying © notice and a link to caffeine.ai with a heart icon.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Provides the main app header with authentication controls, theme toggle, role-based title, and optional dashboard view switching.
frontend/src/components/IcpConnectionPan: Displays ICP network, canister, and connection status with automatic checks, error alerts, and retry support.
frontend/src/components/IcpControllerMan: Manages granting and revoking ICP Controller roles, including input forms, confirmation dialogs, and controller list display.
frontend/src/components/IcpControlsCatal: Renders a searchable, categorized catalog of ICP control settings with support for editing, reset, import, and export.
Renders an individual ICP control input row with dynamic input types based on the control definition.
frontend/src/components/IcpControlsPanel: Provides a wrapper panel introducing ICP controls and linking to the full controls catalog.
frontend/src/components/IcpMainnetDeploy: UI panel explaining prerequisites and step‑by‑step instructions for deploying canisters to the ICP mainnet. Provides alerts, badges, and command snippets for users.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: Modal dialog that collects a user's name and saves it via a mutation. Includes validation, loading state, and form submission handling.
frontend/src/components/RealTimeAlertPan: Displays recent security alerts and flagged users in real time using logs and query data. Highlights critical or warning events from the last five minutes.
frontend/src/components/RolesAccessPanel: Shows caller and App Controller principals, handles initialization, and provides copy and status actions. Includes loading, error, and role‑based UI states.
frontend/src/components/RootTerminalPane: Implements an interactive command terminal with history, command execution, and audit logging. Supports privilege checks and custom command registries.
frontend/src/components/SecuritySummaryP: Computes 24‑hour and 7‑day security metrics and displays summaries such as critical events, failed logins, and unauthorized attempts. Shows alerts for abnormal activity spikes.
frontend/src/components/SuperuserAuditPa: Provides a superuser interface to export audit logs, export flagged users, and record audit actions with status handling and toast notifications.
frontend/src/components/TestActionsPanel: UI for generating and submitting test audit events with selectable action types, severity, and optional metadata.
frontend/src/components/UserManagementPa: Manages user flagging, unflagging, and removal while displaying the list of flagged users with related actions.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the current identity, refreshing dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBackendHealthCheck: Runs a lightweight backend connectivity check using the actor and returns connection status and errors.
frontend/src/hooks/useDashboardView.ts: Manages the selected dashboard view with session persistence and validation based on current access permissions.
frontend/src/hooks/useIcpControls.ts: Loads and manages ICP control settings from URL, session storage, or defaults with setters for network, canister ID, and additional controls.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and provider for managing Internet Identity authentication state and login flows using AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for interacting with backend actor methods, including profile, controller, and security status queries and mutations.
frontend/src/icp-controls/bindings.ts: Implements helpers for retrieving, parsing, serializing, and validating ICP control definitions and their stored values.
frontend/src/icp-controls/registry.ts: Contains the full registry of ICP configuration categories and control definitions for UI and system settings.
frontend/src/icp-controls/types.ts: Defines TypeScript types for control categories, control definitions, and related UI metadata.
frontend/src/index.css: Sets global Tailwind layers and CSS variables for theming in light and dark modes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, wrapping it with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AdminDashboard.tsx: Implements the admin dashboard UI with filters, audit logs, role panels, and various management components.
frontend/src/pages/IcpOpsDashboard.tsx: Renders the ICP operations console with connection panels, auth status, control catalog, and terminal access.
frontend/src/queryKeys.ts: Provides helper functions that generate consistent React Query keys for controller and security-related queries.
frontend/src/terminal/commandRegistry.ts: Exports the default terminal command registry composed of core commands.
frontend/src/terminal/coreCommands.ts: Defines core terminal commands including help, clear, and security role operations with backend and audit integration.
frontend/src/terminal/icpControllerComma: Implements a restricted command set for ICP Controller users, including help, clear, and profile management commands.
frontend/src/terminal/terminalGuards.ts: Contains utility guards for authentication, backend checks, audit recording, error classification, and timestamp/action parsing.
frontend/src/terminal/types.ts: Defines TypeScript interfaces for terminal commands, context, outputs, and history entries.
frontend/src/utils/codeEditorStorage.ts: Manages code editor state in localStorage, including loading, saving, applying changes, and tracking unsaved edits.
frontend/src/utils/icpControls.ts: Provides utilities for determining ICP network defaults, validating canister IDs, and mapping network labels and hosts.
frontend/src/utils/icpControlsImportExpo: Handles exporting, downloading, importing, and reading ICP Controls configuration JSON with validation.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers for reading URL and hash parameters, persisting them in sessionStorage, and clearing stored or hash-based params.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining theme extensions, colors, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: JSON describing project state, planned architecture changes, known issues, and existing feature definitions for the app.
